8902-d-03-07-89-CM.Narrative: TRAIN CREW WENT ON DUTY AT 3:00 A.M. MARCH 7, 1989. TWO YARDMEN HELPED WITH THEIR INITIAL AIR TEST,THEN GUARDED A PUBLIC CROSSING WHILE TRAIN SHOVED EAST TO ADD ANOTHER UNIT TO CONSIST. AFTER THE EXTRA UNIT WAS ADDED THE TRAIN PROCEEDED WEST TOWARD THEIR DESTINATION. THE TWO YARDMEN WERE ON THE GROUND OBSERVING THE TRAIN FOR POSSIBLE DEFECTS. AT THIS TIME NO ONE REALIZED THAT A MAIN LINE SWITCH HAD BEEN LEFT LINED FOR THE INDUSTRY TRACK RATHER THAN THE MAIN LINE. SIXTEEN CARS HAD BEEN TRAILED THROUGH THE SWITCH WITHOUT DERAILING. WHEN THE WESTWARD MOVEMENT BEGAN THE CARS BEYOND THE SWITCH STARTED DOWN THE INDUSTRY TRACK. WHEN ONE OF THE YARD MEN NOTICED THE PROBLEM HE TRIED UNSUCCESSFULLY TO STOP THE TRAIN WITH HIS FLASHLIGHT AND, FAILING IN THIS, THEN RAN TO THE OFFICE WHERE HE CONTACTEDTHE TRAIN CREW BY RADIO AND STOPPED THE TRAIN. BY THE TIME THE TRAIN STOPPED TEN CARS AND TRACK STRUCTURE.NoneNoneNoneNoneNone
